steps.text: Use the Chrome browser for this page.
Do not use a USB hub.
Keep the device disconnected from a power source throughout the update.
To enter firmware loading mode, hold the footswitch and connect a micro-USB cable. The LED will remain unlit until the firmware update is complete.
Hit "Flash Update" and wait for the progress bar to finish.

instructions.footer_note: On windows, you may have to update the driver to WinUSB. To do this, you can download the free software, Zadig. Instructions for this can be found here.

info_section.title: ⚠️ Important Warnings
items: Warranty Notice: User-performed firmware updates may invalidate your warranty if the MCU (microcontroller) is damaged during the update process.

Static Discharge: Before touching the MCU or internal components, discharge any static electricity by touching a grounded metal object (such as a metal water faucet or the metal part of a power outlet cover plate).

Professional Service Available: If you prefer not to perform the update yourself, you can send your device back to us for a free repair/update service (you pay postage only). Contact us at hello@puremagnetik.com for details.

steps.text: Use the Chrome browser for this page.
Do not use a USB hub.
Keep the device disconnected from a power source throughout the update.
Discharge static electricity by touching a grounded metal object before proceeding.
Remove the 4 screws and the bottom plate of the pedal.
Inside the pedal, locate the micro USB port.
Hold SHIFT button while connecting USB cable to enter DFU bootloader mode. The red LED on the Daisy Seed board should light up.
Hit "Flash Update" and wait for the progress bar to finish.

instructions.footer_note: On windows, you may have to update the driver to WinUSB. To do this, you can download the free software, Zadig. Instructions for this can be found here.
